descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Voshon Lenard shook off three sluggish  quarters and scored 11 points over the final 12 minutes against his former team as the Toronto Raptors rallied for an 84-79 triumph over the Denver Nuggets.
article.headline: Lenard, Davis score Raptors' final 12 points
article.story:
TORONTO (AP) -- Antonio Davis came back, and Voshon Lenard came through.
Lenard

Davis

Lenard scored 19 points and Davis added 18, the two combining for Toronto's final 12 points as the Raptors beat the Denver Nuggets 84-79 Friday night. Davis added eight rebounds and three blocks in his return after missing four games due to a strained ribcage muscle. "It just feels good to get back on the floor,'' Davis said. "We continue to fight. If we carry that attitude with us for the rest of the season we're going to be a pretty good team.'' The Raptors won their second straight, improving to 4-4 despite missing star Vince Carter (strained left quadriceps tendon), Lamond Murray (torn ligament in right foot), Eric Montross (fractured left foot), Mamadou N'diaye (stress fracture in right heel) and Nate Huffman (right knee surgery). Jelani McCoy missed his third straight game with a strained back, but Toronto coach Lenny Wilkens expects him to play Sunday against Utah. "You have to look at every win as an accomplishment because we are walking wounded,'' Jerome Williams said. "We haven't had our full team since training camp. We are stepping up.'' James Posey had a season-high 24 points and 12 rebounds for the Nuggets, who have lost four of five. "We played hard,'' Denver coach Jeff Bzdelik said. After Davis' two free throws cut Denver's lead to two, Lenard made a 3-pointer to give Toronto the lead for good with 1:47 left. Following a block by Davis, Lenard made a 3-pointer with 46.7 seconds left to give Toronto an 81-77 lead. Posey followed with a jumper, but Davis made one of two free throws to give Toronto a three-point lead. After Posey missed a 3-pointer with 35 seconds left, Lenard made two free throws with 4.9 seconds remaining to seal the victory. Lenard, who played for Denver last season, scored 10 points in the fourth quarter. "He is a good shooter and he made big shots,'' Posey said. "He did it for us last year.'' Jerome Williams had seven points as Toronto began the second half with a 14-4 run. Alvin Williams stole an inbounds pass and made a breakaway layup, giving the Raptors a 15-point lead -- their biggest lead of the game. But the Nuggets responded with a 16-2 run, including seven straight points from Posey, whose 3-pointer cut Toronto's lead to one with 50 seconds left in the third quarter.

Game notes
Denver point guard Chris Whitney missed his second straight game with a sprained left ankle. ... The Nuggets play in Detroit on Saturday night. ... Denver is last in the NBA in scoring with an average of 79 points per game. ... All Toronto starters scored in double figures.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
